Body: Dave had 19 apps and 18 files on his phone. After deleting some apps and files he had 6 apps and 15 files left.
Question: How many more files than apps does he have left on the phone?

Body: Baker made 99 cakes. He bought 167 new cakes and sold 89 cakes.
Question: How many more cakes did baker buy than those he sold?

Body: 3 birds and 4 storks were sitting on the fence. 6 more storks came to join them.
Question: How many birds and storks are sitting on the fence?

Body: David did 44 push-ups in gym class today. David did 9 more push-ups than Zachary.
Question: How many push-ups did Zachary do?

Body: Edward spent $ 6 to buy books and $ 16 to buy pens. Now he has $ 19.
Question: How much did Edward have before he spent his money?

Body: Bryan took a look at his books as well. Each bookshelf contains 2 books. If he has a total of 38 books
Question: How many bookshelves does he have?

Body: There were 7 roses in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses from her flower garden which had a total of 59 roses. There are now 20 roses in the vase.
Question: How many roses did she cut?

Body: Luke played a trivia game and gained 3 points in each round of a game. If he scored 78 points in the trivia game
Question: How many rounds did he play?

Body: Baker made 13 cakes. He sold 91 of them and bought 154 new cakes.
Question: How many more cakes did baker buy than those he sold?

Body: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 71 sacks of unripe oranges and 60 sacks of ripe oranges per day.
Question: How many more sacks of unripe oranges than ripe oranges are harvested per day?
